property.name: _windowProperties
property.value: {bounds={41, 23, 1184, 712}, maximized=false}

property.name: text
property.value:
This model presents a pure dataflow approach to a real-time accessor composition problem.
We assume a host that provides a data stream that wants to insert and activate internet-obtained data at certain points. The host uses accessors to fetch the data. We assume no control over the length and content of internet data. The accessors are non-blocking, similar to most Javascript programs.
Here, the goal is to assemble a song from a set of verse clips and internet data. The song is "The Fox (What Does The Fox Say?) by Ylvis http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Fox_%28What_Does_the_Fox_Say%3F%29 The animal sounds are from SeaWorld: http://seaworld.org/en/animal-info/animal-sounds/
Unfortunately, some problems arise: 1. Verses start too soon: No control over the starting time of the verses. 2. Overlapping sounds: The stop time of the clip is not controlled. Clips are too long. (If a blocking implementation is used, then the total length will be too long.) 3. Error handling. Is that really a mouse?

property.name: text
property.value: Author: Elizabeth Latronico

property.name: text
property.value: output port type set to boolean on all accessors

property.name: text
property.value: This model requires audio files at: https://www.icyphy.org/accessors/wiki/Main/WhatMoCs?

property.name: text
property.value: Please turn your speakers on :) Requires Java 1.8

property.name: script
note
property.value: NOTE: To see the script, invoke Open Actor

property.name: description
property.value: An accessor for playing a sound clip.

property.name: author
property.value: Elizabeth Osyk (beth@berkeley.edu)

property.name: clipURL (parameter)
property.value: The URL to retrieve the sound clip from.

property.name: stop (port)
property.value: A trigger to stop playback. The value is ignored and can be anything.

property.name: start (port)
property.value: A trigger input to start playback. The value is ignored and can be anything.
